segment.source: Microsoft Manufacturing OS
segment.target: Microsoft Manufacturing OS

segment.source: Microsoft Manufacturing OS
segment.target: Microsoft Manufacturing OS

segment.source: Microsoft Manufacturing OS
segment.target: Microsoft Manufacturing OS

segment.source: Microsoft Manufacturing OS (MMOS), an optimized configuration of the operating system, facilitates efficient manufacturing.
segment.target: Microsoft Manufacturing OS (MMOS), an optimized configuration of the operating system, facilitates efficient manufacturing.

segment.source: MMOS is intended to provide the following capabilities:
segment.target: MMOS is intended to provide the following capabilities:

segment.source: Fast boot time resulting from a smaller image that contains only the code necessary to support manufacturing test execution.
segment.target: Fast boot time resulting from a smaller image that contains only the code necessary to support manufacturing test execution.

segment.source: The smaller OS image can be flashed quickly, accelerating the manufacturing process.
segment.target: The smaller OS image can be flashed quickly, accelerating the manufacturing process.

segment.source: The ability to create an OEM-customized MMOS image that includes unique drivers and test applications.
segment.target: The ability to create an OEM-customized MMOS image that includes unique drivers and test applications.

segment.source: Support for OEM-developed component-level testing, in addition to full-function quality and calibration testing.
segment.target: Support for OEM-developed component-level testing, in addition to full-function quality and calibration testing.

segment.source: Access to low-level native APIs for direct testing of phone hardware components.
segment.target: Access to low-level native APIs for direct testing of phone hardware components.

segment.source: The ability to create a mechanism to remotely control the test application and retrieve test logs over a USB communication channel.
segment.target: The ability to create a mechanism to remotely control the test application and retrieve test logs over a USB communication channel.

segment.source: No dependency on display or touch hardware, to allow for headless operation.
segment.target: No dependency on display or touch hardware, to allow for headless operation.

segment.source: The ability to directly boot into MMOS in a manufacturing environment.
segment.target: The ability to directly boot into MMOS in a manufacturing environment.

segment.source: Automated launch of OEM test applications when MMOS is booted.
segment.target: Automated launch of OEM test applications when MMOS is booted.

segment.source: The ability to write to the DPP partition to store unique, per-phone data.
segment.target: The ability to write to the DPP partition to store unique, per-phone data.

segment.source: Battery charging is supported in both UEFI and MMOS.
segment.target: Battery charging is supported in both UEFI and MMOS.

segment.source: It is set using a feature setting, so partners can turn it on and off as desired.
segment.target: It is set using a feature setting, so partners can turn it on and off as desired.

segment.source: For more info, see MMOS image definition.
segment.target: For more info, see MMOS image definition.

segment.source: Working with MMOS
segment.target: Working with MMOS

segment.source: This section describes how to build and flash an MMOS image.
segment.target: This section describes how to build and flash an MMOS image.

segment.source: To work with MMOS, complete the following tasks:
segment.target: To work with MMOS, complete the following tasks:

segment.source: Create your test application or other manufacturing tools as packages.
segment.target: Create your test application or other manufacturing tools as packages.

segment.source: For more info, see Creating packages.
segment.target: For more info, see Creating packages.

segment.source: Create a flashing protocol and add packages to support that functionality to MMOS.
segment.target: Create a flashing protocol and add packages to support that functionality to MMOS.

segment.source: For more info, see Flashing tools.
segment.target: For more info, see Flashing tools.

segment.source: Create the MMOS image.
segment.target: Create the MMOS image.

segment.source: For more info, see MMOS image definition.
segment.target: For more info, see MMOS image definition.

segment.source: Flash the MMOS image to the device.
segment.target: Flash the MMOS image to the device.

segment.source: For more info, see Flash MMOS to the device.
segment.target: For more info, see Flash MMOS to the device.

segment.source: Deploy manufacturing applications.
segment.target: Deploy manufacturing applications.

segment.source: For more info, see Deploy and test a user-mode test application in MMOS.
segment.target: For more info, see Deploy and test a user-mode test application in MMOS.

segment.source: Evaluate if you want to create a WIM to be able to run MMOS in RAM.
segment.target: Evaluate if you want to create a WIM to be able to run MMOS in RAM.

segment.source: For more info, see Working with WIM MMOS images.
segment.target: For more info, see Working with WIM MMOS images.

segment.source: Developing user mode test applications
segment.target: Developing user mode test applications

segment.source: To create a user mode test applications to test the device in manufacturing, complete the following tasks:
segment.target: To create a user mode test applications to test the device in manufacturing, complete the following tasks:

segment.source: Develop the user mode test application using the MMOS library.
segment.target: Develop the user mode test application using the MMOS library.

segment.source: For more info, see Manufacturing test environment supported APIs and Develop MMOS test applications.
segment.target: For more info, see Manufacturing test environment supported APIs and Develop MMOS test applications.

segment.source: A service can be used to start a user mode test application.
segment.target: A service can be used to start a user mode test application.

segment.source: If desired, the test application can communicate with a test controller on a PC to control the testing process and to log results.
segment.target: If desired, the test application can communicate with a test controller on a PC to control the testing process and to log results.

segment.source: To configure the service to start automatically when the OS boots, set the Start attribute to "Auto" in the service package configuration file.
segment.target: To configure the service to start automatically when the OS boots, set the Start attribute to "Auto" in the service package configuration file.

segment.source: This capability is only available in MMOS.
segment.target: This capability is only available in MMOS.

segment.source: Some apps should only be allowed to run in MMOS.
segment.target: Some apps should only be allowed to run in MMOS.

segment.source: You can use an API to determine if MMOS is running or not.
segment.target: You can use an API to determine if MMOS is running or not.

segment.source: For more info, see Determine if MMOS is running.
segment.target: For more info, see Determine if MMOS is running.

segment.source: To cause the device to enter the connected standby power state, call the SetScreenOff function.
segment.target: To cause the device to enter the connected standby power state, call the SetScreenOff function.

segment.source: For more info, see Calling SetScreenOff to enter connected standby.
segment.target: For more info, see Calling SetScreenOff to enter connected standby.

segment.target: Related topics

segment.target: Develop MMOS test applications
